DOC.brief_title: Impact Life-Style Modification On Ablation Outcome Atrial Fibrillation
DOC.detailed_description: Objective : To examine impact plan life-style modification program include calorie-controlled diet supervise exercise AF ablation quality life ( QoL ) long-term arrhythmia recurrence overweight obese patient atrial fibrillation . Endpoints : Primary : AF recurrence follow index ablation procedure It assess 3 , 6 12 month procedure event recorder , 12-lead ECG Holter monitor Any episode AF/AFL/AT > 30 sec consider recurrence . Episodes occur first 3 month procedure ( blanking period ) consider recurrence . Secondary : 1 . Change QoL It evaluate validated AF specific questionnaire ( AFEQT ) baseline 6 12 month post-procedure 2 . Change exercise capacity It examine baseline 6 12 month post procedure patient utilizing cardiopulmonary exercise test ( CPX ) Vmax Encore equipment Care Fusion , CA , USA . 3 . Change AF symptom severity . This measure AF symptom severity burden questionnaire baseline 6 12 month post-procedure DIET : Participants intervention group receive individual counseling session experience dietitian , prepare personalize diet plan base comorbidities preference . To accomplish weight loss , diet menu plan reduce daily food intake ≥ 500 calorie depend baseline body weight . Patients enrol control group provide advice heart-healthy diet active life style . EXERCISE : Supervised monitor exercise conduct St. David 's Cardiac Rehabilitation 3 month ablation . After ablation , patient continue individualized home-exercise program 1 year . QoL Survey : The AF Effect Quality Life survey ( AFEQT ) questionnaire use baseline 6 12 month post procedure . Symptom Severity Survey : This measure AF symptom severity burden questionnaire baseline 6 12 month post-procedure
